intro: Jaltomata propinqua, commonly known as the narrowleaf jaltomata, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale purple, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Jaltomata propinqua is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
